pages.text: Welcome to ApiElectric! This mod allows you to harness the power of specialized Energy Bees to generate HoneyCharge (HC), a unique energy source that can power various machines.$(br2)In this guide, we'll walk you through setting up your first HoneyCharge farm and introduce you to the core mechanics.

pages.title: What is HoneyCharge?
pages.text: HoneyCharge (HC) is a special form of energy produced by Energy Bees. It's measured in HoneyCharge Units (HCU) and can be stored, transferred, and used to power different machines.$(br2)Unlike regular bees, Energy Bees produce electrical energy instead of honey, making them invaluable for powering your technological advancements.

pages.title: Energy Bee Spawner
pages.text: The Energy Bee Spawner is your first step into bee-powered technology. It automatically spawns Energy Bees in the area (up to 10 bees within a 10-block radius).

pages.title: Energized Flower
pages.text: Energy Bees are attracted to Energized Flowers. Plant these around your apiary to keep your bees happy and productive. Bees will collect charged pollen from these flowers.

pages.title: Energy Apiary
pages.text: The Energy Apiary houses Energy Bees and converts their activities into HoneyCharge. Place this block near Energized Flowers for maximum efficiency.

pages.title: Basic Setup
pages.text: For your first HoneyCharge farm, follow these steps:$(br)1. Craft an Energy Bee Spawner and place it in an open area$(br)2. Plant several Energized Flowers nearby$(br)3. Place an Energy Apiary near the flowers$(br)4. Wait for bees to populate and begin generating HoneyCharge

pages.title: Honey Charge Conduit
pages.text: Once your apiary is generating HoneyCharge, use Honey Charge Conduits to transfer energy between machines. These conduits can transfer up to 500 HCU/tick.

pages.title: Honey Charge Furnace
pages.text: The Honey Charge Furnace is one of the simplest machines that uses HoneyCharge. It works like a standard furnace but is faster and uses HoneyCharge instead of fuel.

pages.title: Next Steps
pages.text: Now that you have a basic HoneyCharge farm, explore the other entries to learn about:$(br)- Scaling up production with multiple apiaries$(br)- Storing large amounts of energy with Comb Capacitors$(br)- Converting HoneyCharge to other mod energy systems$(br)- Advanced automation techniques
